intro: Schistostephium umbellatum, commonly known as the Umbellate Schistostephium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is the umbellate inflorescence, which consists of a cluster of small, yellow flowers arranged in a circular pattern. Schistostephium umbellatum is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
